official_title: Proton Beam Radiation Therapy in Patients with Resected N2 Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
brief_title: Proton Beam Radiation Therapy After Treatment for Resected N2 Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
cancer_type_display: A study evaluating proton beam radiation therapy for patients with resected N2 non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have received pre-operative systemic therapy.
key_inclusion_summary: Must have undergone complete surgical resection (R0) after pre-operative systemic therapy.
Pathology report must indicate tumor involvement of at least one mediastinal lymph node (pN2).
ECOG performance status of 2 or less.
key_exclusion_summary: Tumors that have targetable alterations in EGFR or ALK.
Significant cardiovascular disease within 3 months prior to study start.
